name: 李紹先
objective: This course introduces fundamental concepts in Materials Science & Engineering. You will learn about the material structure, how structure dictates properties and how processing can change the structures.
schedule:
Week 1  course introduction.
week 2 Introduction to Materials Science and Engineering (Chapter 1)
week 3 Atomic Structure and Interatomic Bonding (Chapter 2)
week 4 Atomic Structure and Interatomic Bonding / Fundamentals of Crystallography (Chapter 3)
week 5 Fundamentals of Crystallography (Chapter 3)
week 6 The Structure of Crystalline Solids (Chapter 4)
week 7 The Structure of Crystalline Solids (Chapter 4)
week 8 Imperfections in Solids (Chapter 6)

week 9 mid-term 

week 10 Imperfections in Solids (Chapter 6) / Diffusion (Chapter 7) 
week 11 Diffusion (Chapter 7) 
week 12 Diffusion (Chapter 7) / Mechanical Properties of Metals (Chapter 8)
week 13 Mechanical Properties of Metals (Chapter 8)
week 14 Mechanical Properties of Metals (Chapter 8)
week 15 Dislocations and Strengthening Mechanism (Chapter 9)
week 16 Dislocations and Strengthening Mechanism (Chapter 9)
week 17 Dislocations and Strengthening Mechanism (Chapter 9) / Failure (Chapter 10)

week 18 final exam
materials:
Materials Science and Engineering
Tenth Edition
WILLIAM D.CALLISTER, JR. and DAVID G. RETHWISCH
consultation: email: ssli@ntut.edu.tw office: Building of Materials Engineering, R403.
